page.title: 06Gunthwaite Barn
page.content: Gunthwaite Barn was built by{Godfrey {Bosville. }It is an old aisle barn. It is a great, long barn which looks like a church inside with wooden pillars making the aisles. It reminded us of an old wooden ship. The barn is held together with wooden pins and there are no nails in it at all. The roof has been repaired and the barn has been divided up into bays. Outside where the big hall was is an old, giant oak tree. They say there are a lot of{Oliver Cromwell's men buried beneath it. The hall is not there any more but two large houses. In the Civil War the Bosvilles were on Cromwell's side. To the east of the barn is Gunthwaite Spa. People used to come from miles around on{Spa Sunday}but it is not as popular now. The water tastes horribly of sulphur.
